articles.author: Adam Lashinsky
articles.title: The coronavirus requires startups to conserve cash, a VC firm says
articles.description: VC firm Sequoia Capital has some advice during the coronavirus outbreak.

articles.author: Naomi Xu Elegant
articles.title: Why are patients who recover from coronavirus testing positive again?
articles.description: Instances of patients catching coronavirus twice are popping up—but scientists are skeptical about how real that occurrence is.

articles.author: Danielle Abril
articles.title: Facebook advises Bay Area employees to stay home amid coronavirus concerns
articles.description: Facebook is the next Bay Area tech company to tell its employees to work from home as more cases of the coronavirus are confirmed in the region.

articles.author: Jenna Schnuer
articles.title: Coronavirus drives Austin, Texas officials to cancel South by Southwest
articles.description: Several high-profile companies had already pulled out of the 2020 SXSW festival because of coronavirus before the city of Austin finally nixed the festival outright.

articles.author: Sy Mukherjee
articles.title: What the rising coronavirus death rate really means
articles.description: "I think the mortality is going to end up at 1% or below, consistent with the H1N1 flu outbreak of 2009," said one analyst.

articles.author: Jaclyn Gallucci
articles.title: Trump signs $8.3B bill to combat coronavirus outbreak in U.S.
articles.description: President Donald Trump on Friday signed an $8.3 billion measure to help tackle the coronavirus outbreak that has killed 12 people in the U.S. and infected more than 200. The legislation provides federal public health agencies with money for vaccines, tests an…

articles.author: James Nosek
articles.title: Apple encourages Silicon Valley staff to work from home due to coronavirus
articles.description: Apple has two main headquarters in Cupertino, California— in addition to offices elsewhere in Santa Clara County.

articles.author: reymashayekhi
articles.title: Coronavirus fears spur more volatility as 10-year Treasury yield hits an all-time low
articles.description: Among the industry sectors tracked by the S&P 500, banks and travel companies were hit particularly hard.

articles.author: eamonbarrett
articles.title: 100,000 coronavirus cases: How COVID-19 defied borders to reach this new milestone
articles.description: The outbreak has exposed borders as flimsy human constructs and underscored the world's vast connectedness.

articles.author: Ian Mount
articles.title: China worried that coronavirus would cause a market meltdown. Its reaction risks stoking a bubble instead
articles.description: From early February, the central bank and regulators have deployed a number of measures to ensure sufficient liquidity and reduce borrowing costs for companies.

articles.author: Anne Sraders
articles.title: Where is the stock market headed? Wall Street can’t make up its mind amid coronavirus outbreak
articles.description: Wall Street is closely monitoring these indicators to try and predict what comes next.

articles.author: kdunn6
articles.title: To tackle coronavirus, Brits are appealing to an age-old rallying cry: ‘Blitz Spirit’
articles.description: It's been used to describe the response to everything from snowstorms to terror attacks to Brexit. Why not coronavirus?

articles.author: Sy Mukherjee
articles.title: CVS will waive out-of-pocket costs related to coronavirus testing and telemedicine visits
articles.description: CVS Health says Aetna plan members won't face any co-pays or pay out-of-pocket for coronavirus-related testing—or telemedicine visits.
